title: Migration Guide lacks information about GraalVM version upgrade

labels.name: area/housekeeping
labels.description: Issue type for generalized tasks not related to bugs or enhancements

body:
### Description

Hello, 

When upgrading my Quarkus projects, I usually read the changelog and the migration guide in this repository's wiki. (https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/wiki/Migration-Guides) and then proceed upgrading the version, and follow specific guideline if needed. 

On quarkus.io, there is a guide about how to build native image : https://quarkus.io/guides/building-native-image
And I noticed that the recommended GraalVM version in this guide often changes with newer version of Quarkus.

In the [latest version](https://quarkus.io/guides/building-native-image), 2.9 as i'm writing this, GraalVM 22.0 is recommended.

> Version 22.0 is required. Using the community edition is enough.

In the [2.7 guide](https://quarkus.io/version/2.7/guides/building-native-image), GraalVM 21.3.1 is recommended.

> Version 21.3.1 is required. Using the community edition is enough.

However, there is no mention of this change in either 2.8 and 2.9 Migration Guide from this repository.

Shouldn't this information be included in the Migration Guides ?

Regards,

Khopa



### Implementation ideas

Example implementation for 2.9 migration guide:

# Native Image Build/GraalVM:
 
 New recommended GraalVM version to build a native executable is 22.0
